sentences.en: Close your eyes. Relax. Let your body loosen up.
sentences.cn: 闭上眼睛。放松。让身体尽量松弛。

sentences.en: First loosen the nuts, then take off the wheel.
sentences.cn: 先松开螺母，然后卸下车轮。

sentences.en: I'll need that screwdriver to loosen these screws.
sentences.cn: 我需要那只改锥旋松这些螺丝.

sentences.en: Insert a small knife into the top of the chicken breast to loosen the skin.
sentences.cn: 在鸡胸上方插进一把小刀，以使鸡皮不要绷得太紧。

sentences.en: Loosen some sails to ease down the speed of the boat.
sentences.cn: 落下几面帆,把船速降下来.

sentences.en: Loosen the bolt so the bars can be turned.
sentences.cn: 松一松插销，好转动门闩。

sentences.en: Many business groups have been pressing the Federal Reserve to loosen interest rates.
sentences.cn: 不少企业集团一直在向联邦储备委员会施压，要求其放松利率管制。

sentences.en: Officials have been instructed to loosen up on the rules for admitting people into the country.
sentences.cn: 官员们已收到命令放宽对入境人员的限制.

sentences.en: Relax, smile; loosen up in mind and body and behaviour.
sentences.cn: 放松，微笑。精神、身体和行为上都要放轻松。

sentences.en: Squeeze the foot with both hands, again to loosen up tight muscles.
sentences.cn: 双手捏脚，目的也是使紧张的肌肉松弛下来。

sentences.en: Take each foot in both your hands and rotate it to loosen and relax the ankle.
sentences.cn: 双手抓住自己的双脚，转动一下，以放松脚踝。

sentences.en: The medicine may loosen your cough.
sentences.cn: 这种药能减轻你的咳嗽.

sentences.en: We must, somehow, find a way to loosen the bonds of tradition.
sentences.cn: 我们不管怎样都必须找到摆脱传统束缚的途径。

sentences.en: You’ll need a spanner to loosen that bolt.
sentences.cn: 你需要扳手来拧开那个螺栓。

sentences.en: Young people often loosen up on the dance floor.
sentences.cn: 年轻人常在舞池中放松自己。

sentences.en: Your shoes will loosen up with wear.

phrases.tran_cn: 无拘束地说，无顾忌地说
放松肌肉；松弛；[口]信口开河；[口]慷慨解囊

trans.tran_en: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

trans.tran_cn: 解开或使松，放宽，放松，使（肠）通畅
trans.tran_en: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened
